Posts.Content: Sep 19, 2018 09:29PM Ann2018 wrote: blu, like lyzzysmom said do not be afraid to speak up if it starts to hurt, they can give you another shot and another and.... until you are comfortable. This part is not what worries us the most,it’s the results. Take care and please let us know how it went and results. I am hoping to get a call from the doctor by Friday. I guess if he says he needs to see me that usually means bad news.

Posts.Content: Sep 20, 2018 12:58PM Ann2018 wrote: hello, Got a call from my appointment scheduler that my results are it and it is B9!!! But I need to repeat mammo in 6 months. BluGene, keep me posted how you doing.

Posts.Content: Ann2018 wrote: hello everyone, This is a great site and a great community. Like all I am super worried and have my 1st core ultrasound on Tuesday afternoon. I think I’ve read almost everting on the site and I understand that it shouldn’t hurt, but still scared. I think I am more scared about getting results than having the biopsy, but i’ll cross that bridge a few days after biopsy. Thank you Ann Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I guess I am one of the worried ones Ann2018 Ann2018

Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2018 09:17PM Ann2018 wrote: hey blu, I had core ultrasound guided. I have to say that the shot hurt bc the doctor kept going around and up the breast. But again, this lasted mb a minute. I’ve read that some had these great nurses that kept talking to them & holding their hand. I had nothing like that. Nurses were very professional but not compassionate. But the doctor was awesome. I am going to call my appointment scheduler & thank her bc she changed my appointment from 27th to today and I am grateful. After about 5 hours it started to hurt so I took 2 Tylenols. The side still hurts but it’s bearable. I am sleeping in my zip front bra not to have them plop around. Other than that I am in a waiting & hoping for the best mode. Good luck with the stereotactic, just ask for a lot of numbing. You can do this, sometimes we surprise ourselves at how strong we are. Please let me know how it went & please think positive. Ann
Posts.Title: I guess I am one of the worried ones Ann2018 Ann2018

Posts.Content: Sep 19, 2018 11:20AM Ann2018 wrote: I think what you are having is when your breasts are pushed thru the openings. I was told that patients lovingly call it «the oil change». I think it should be very similar, just the image taking is different. But please read the info on this site, the girls are a wealth of information. The night was a bit restless as I couldn’t find position to fall asleep except being prepped very high up almost in sitting position. Once I went for the ice pack. I took off the bandage in the morning and looked at the side of my breast. It’s not bruised yet, I think it will come later, but the initial site is sore to the touch and I can’t stretch my arm. Hopefully tomorrow i’ll feel better and go to work, but my boss was very understanding even tho I never told him what kind of procedure I am having; he told me to let him know if I need to take another day off too. What I strongly recommend is taking the day off the next day after the biopsy if you can, especially if it’s not an office type job. But again, everyone is different. I do however have a high pain tolerance
Posts.Title: I guess I am one of the worried ones Ann2018 Ann2018

Posts.Content: Sep 20, 2018 09:42PM Ann2018 wrote: what is strange, that I got a call from the radiology place where I had my biopsy done early a.m., but nothing fromnot my doctor. How long do you think until he calls me? Doesn’t he realize when the doctor of radiology tells you that you have abnormality and you need a biopsy, right the way a person thinks the worst and when the results come in your doctor needs to call right the way so the patient doesn’t have to wonder & cry all the time like I did. I am never going to see that doctor again.really disappointed that doctors that pledge the Hippocratic Oath during medical school still have no compassion. Shame.
Posts.Title: I guess I am one of the worried ones Ann2018 Ann2018

Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2018 03:10PM - edited Sep 18, 2018 03:14PM by Ann2018 hello, I had biopsy just an hour ago. Like most of you said the worst part is the shot and I asked the doctor to give me as much as legally allowed. The doctor was extremely nice & caring, answered all my stupid questions. I started to cry at one point not because it hurt but because she was so super positiveand I felt sorry for myself. The procedure itself took maybe 10 minutes at best, just the signing & explaining, and at the end the mammo combined was about an hour. Thank you to all for the tip with zip front sports bra. I took the day off work tomorrow, just to rest and take it easy. So now the waiting begins: 3-5 days. Wow, they do take their time.
Posts.Title: I guess I am one of the worried ones Ann2018 Ann2018
